intro: Cinnamomum glabrum, commonly known as the slender cinnamon tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Its bark and leaves are used in traditional medicine and for their aromatic properties. The tree typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters and prefers moist, well-drained soils.
